sen.j: 九鬼 隆常（くき たかつね、正保3年（1646年） - 元禄11年4月1日 (旧暦)（1698年5月10日））は、丹波国綾部藩の第2代藩主。
sen.e: Takatsune KUKI (1646 - May 10, 1698) was the second lord of Ayabe Domain in Tanba Province.
Takatsune KUKI (1646 - May 10, 1698) was the second lord of Ayabe Domain in Tanba Province.
Takatsune KUKI (1646 - May 10, 1698) was the second lord of Ayabe Domain in Tanba Province.

sen.j: 初代藩主・九鬼隆季の長男。
sen.e: He was the eldest son of Takasue KUKI, who was the first lord of the domain.
He was the eldest son of Takasue KUKI, who was the first lord of the domain.
He was the eldest son of Takasue KUKI, who was the first lord of the domain.
His lawful wife was a daughter of Kadokatsu ISHIKAWA.
His lawful wife was a daughter of Kadokatsu ISHIKAWA.
His lawful wife was a daughter of Kadokatsu ISHIKAWA.

sen.j: 継室は保科正景の娘、牧野富成の養女（建部政明の娘）。
sen.e: His second wife was a daughter of Masakage HOSHINA and an adopted daughter of Tomishige MAKINO (a daughter of Masaaki TATEBE).
His second wives were a daughter of Masakage HOSHINA and an adopted daughter of Tomishige MAKINO (a daughter of Masaaki TATEBE).
His second wives were a daughter of Masakage HOSHINA and an adopted daughter of Tomishige MAKINO (a daughter of Masaaki TATEBE).

sen.j: 子は九鬼隆幸（長男）、娘（朽木長綱正室）。
sen.e: He had a son, Takayuki KUKI (who was the elder child) and a daughter (who was later to become a lawful wife of Nagatsuna KUTSUKI).
He had a son, Takayuki KUKI (first son) and a daughter (a lawful wife of Nagatsuna KUTSUKI).
He had a son, Takayuki KUKI (first son) and a daughter (a lawful wife of Nagatsuna KUTSUKI).

sen.j: 官位は従五位下、大隅国守。
sen.e: His official court rank was Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) and his duty was Osumi no kuni no kami (Governor of Osumi Province).
His official court rank was Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) and his duty was Osumi no kuni no kami (Governor of Osumi Province).
His official court rank was Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) and his duty was Osumi no kuni no kami (Governor of Osumi Province).

sen.j: 延宝2年（1674年）11月16日、父の隠居により後を継ぐ。
sen.e: On November 16, 1674, he succeeded his father upon his retirement.
On December 13, 1674, he succeeded his father upon his retirement.
On December 13, 1674, he succeeded his father upon his retirement.

sen.j: しかしその年に水害が起こったのをはじめ、延宝8年（1680年）にも大洪水と2度の大火が起こる。
sen.e: Even after a flood disaster which had occurred in that year, a deluge and two conflagrations broke out in 1680.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Even after a flood disaster which had occurred in that year, a deluge and two conflagrations broke out in 1680.
Even after a flood disaster which had occurred in that year, a deluge and two conflagrations broke out in 1680.

sen.j: このように、天災のために治世は多難を極めた。
sen.e: Due to these and other natural disasters, his reign was full of difficulties.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Due to these and other natural disasters, his reign was full of difficulties.
Due to these and other natural disasters, his reign was full of difficulties.

sen.j: 元禄11年（1698年）4月1日、参勤交代途上の三河国池鯉鮒（現愛知県知立市）にて死去。
sen.e: On April 1, 1698, he died at Chiryu-juku in Mikawa Province (present-day Chiryu City, Aichi Prefecture) on his way to go up to Edo for an alternate-year attendance called Sankinkotai (a system under which feudal lords in the Edo period were required to spend every other year in residence in Edo).

On May 10, 1698, he died at Chiryu-juku in Mikawa Province (present-day Chiryu City, Aichi Prefecture) on his way to go up to Edo for an alternate-year attendance called Sankinkotai (a system under which feudal lords in the Edo period were required to spend every other year in residence in Edo).

On May 10, 1698, he died at Chiryu-juku in Mikawa Province (present-day Chiryu City, Aichi Prefecture) on his way to go up to Edo for an alternate-year attendance called Sankinkotai (a system under which feudal lords in the Edo period were required to spend every other year in residence in Edo).
He died at the age of 53.
He died at the age of 53.
He died at the age of 53.

sen.j: 後を養嗣子の九鬼隆直が継いだ。
sen.e: He was succeeded by Takanao KUKI, who was his adopted heir.
He was succeeded by Takanao KUKI, who was his adopted heir.
He was succeeded by Takanao KUKI, who was his adopted heir.
His hogo (a Buddhist name) was Jingakuryoken Kentokuin.
sen.cmt: 仁岳了賢乾徳院の読み方不明です。
sen.e: His hogo (a Buddhist name) was Jingakuryoken Kentokuin.
His hogo (a Buddhist name) was Jingakuryoken Kentokuin.
